result.execSummary:
The defendant Ryan Timothy Renner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver THC (>200-1000g) [Modifiers: Repeater, PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)2.
  • Possess w/ Intent-THC(>200-1000g) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)2.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent to each other, but consecutive to any other sentence the defendant may be serving.  Sentence is to commence immediately.  On March 26, 2015 the Court amends the JOC to reflect no sentence credit.

superMiscConds.notes:
1.  Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
2.  Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent.
3.  Defendant is to undergo, participate in and successfully complete alcohol and drug abuse assessment and comply with any follow-up counseling as recommended.
4.  No Contact with Branden Juneau and Alvin Gardner.  Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision.

State vs Peasley / Charles E. Dukes / Criminal Complaint from Waushara Co 2013CF122

2:55 p.m. Defendant in custody and present in court with Atty Erik Johnson.  Scott Johnson as Special Prosecutor for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Special Prosecutor - an agreement has been reached, defendant will plea to count 1, as a repeater and as PTAC, and count 2 as a repeater and count 3 will be dismissed and read-in.  Atty Johnson concurs.  Defendant concurs.  

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty, as repeater and PTAC.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.  Court instructs regarding felony prohibitions.

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST to counts 1 & 2.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty to counts 1 & 2 as charged.  Court orders count 3 be dismissed and read-in.  Special Prosecutor confirms compliance with victim witness rights.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  Sentencing statement by Special Prosecutor.  Sentencing statement by Atty Johnson.  Statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

EACH COUNT (1 & 2)
2 years of Initial Confinement and 3 years of Extended Supervision - concurrent to each other but consecutive to any other sentence the defendant may be serving  Sentence is to commence immediately.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION

Court costs
Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent.
Defendant is to undergo, participate in and successfully complete alcohol and drug abuse assessment and comply with any follow-up counseling as recommended.
No Contact with Branden Juneau and Alvin Gardner.  Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision.

Court grants the defendant 40 days of sentence credit.

Defendant is eligible for the CIP and SAP.

Court adjourned at 3:19 p.m.
to Impach with Prior Convictions

Attorney Blader files an Information with the court and provides a copy to Attorney Johnson.  Attorney Johnson confirms receipt of the Information - waives reading - enters a plea of NOT GUILTY on behalf of the defendant to all counts.  Court makes statement regarding the maximum penalties.

Court directs Status Hearing to be scheduled.

10:22 a.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Special Prosecutor Chuck Stertz for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading.  Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count and as a repeater.  Court finds probable cause.  Court instructs defendant of his/her right to an attorney.  Bond has been set.  Court instructs defendant regarding his/her right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant waives the time limits.  Court will set for Status Hearing regarding counsel in approx 2 weeks.

Court adjourned at 10:25 a.m.
